result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arthur J Williams

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:30 PM Defendant Arthur J Williams in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Arthur J Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense is requesting a plea/sentencing hearing in 2-3 weeks. Court sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to have no contact with victim A/Evolution Bar listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. The Defendant shall not be in any bars in the downtown City of Waukesha (EXCEPTION: The defendant can be located at the restaurant in which he works.)   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day of being released.

2:51 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
